body_html:
Ok, so I made sure pytorch wasn't installed in the global python. Checked & removed /lib/python3.6/site-packages/ from the Anaconda sys.path. Now the sys.path only shows
['', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python36.zip', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/lib-dynload', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages']

Still, get
ImportError: /home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: cudnnSetConvolutionGroupCount

Again, runtime gist and the dependencies of the .so from the error
body_text:
Ok, so I made sure pytorch wasn't installed in the global python. Checked & removed /lib/python3.6/site-packages/ from the Anaconda sys.path. Now the sys.path only shows
['', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python36.zip', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/lib-dynload', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages']
Still, get
ImportError: /home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: cudnnSetConvolutionGroupCount
Again, runtime gist and the dependencies of the .so from the error
body:
Ok, so I made sure pytorch wasn't installed in the global python. Checked & removed `/lib/python3.6/site-packages/` from the Anaconda `sys.path`. Now the `sys.path` only shows 
`['', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python36.zip', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/lib-dynload', '/home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages']`

Still, get
`ImportError: /home/piotr/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: cudnnSetConvolutionGroupCount`

Again, runtime [gist](https://gist.github.com/PiotrSokol/3f77252bef89e48a0bf81638604175cd) and the [dependencies](https://gist.github.com/PiotrSokol/8f26cdf99dbdb58b53ce837b09d959f6) of the `.so` from the error
